thread.title: Chelsea FC transfer news: Antonio Conte set to run the rule over Burnley star Michael Keane | Metro News
thread.title_full: Chelsea FC transfer news: Antonio Conte set to run the rule over Burnley star Michael Keane | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Chelsea FC transfer news: Antonio Conte set to run the rule over Burnley star Michael Keane | Metro News
text:
Follow us Antonio Conte set to run the rule over Burnley’s Michael Keane ahead of possible transfer move gossip Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Saturday 11 Feb 2017 9:00 pm Chelsea boss Antonio Conte (Picture: Getty) 
Antonio Conte is set to run the rule over potential transfer target Michael Keane when Chelsea travel to Burnley on Sunday. 
Keane, 24, has enjoyed a productive campaign for the Clarets, who have driven themselves away from the relegation dog-fight under Sean Dyche. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
The ex-England U21 star will only have 12 months remaining on his current contract come the end of the season and the Daily Mail say Burnley are resigned to losing him. 
Chelsea are one of a number of clubs understood to be keeping tabs on Keane’s performances and Sunday will give Conte the chance to see the defender in action. 
The Blues have won 19 of their 24 league games this term but will need to overturn Burnley’s impressive home-record to record another victory. Chelsea fixtures 
Swansea (H) – Sat 25 Feb West Ham (A) – Mon 6 Mar Watford (H) – Mon 13 Mar Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr Michael Keane has impressed for Burnley this term (Picture: Getty) 
Only two Premier League teams have been better in front of their own fans than the Clarets during the current campaign – Dyche’s side have won nine of their 13 home games.
